TestStyles

Method Detail

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
Main test method There are 3 subtests: 1. Simple string arguments to show how simple the the api can be reduced to single appl call w subject, resource, and action strings 2. Mappers: shows use of object mappers that allows submission of native java objects for authorization, where the mappers take the relevant info from the objects and translate them to xacml attrs 3. SubjectMapper: shows how std jaas subject can be a java object submitted in the az process, which uses a SubjectMapper to translate info in jaas Subject to xacml attrs.

Throws:
java.lang.Exception

public void testStyleString()
                     throws java.lang.Exception
Test #1: Strings String style 1 i. simple strings, process obligations

Throws:
java.lang.Exception

testStyleMappers

public void testStyleMappers()
                      throws java.lang.Exception
Test #2: Mappers String + attr style 1a ii. convert from JAAS Subject, Permission Set the mappers that will be used by each category: Subject, Action, Resource, Environment. The list of mappers for each category defines the objects that may be submitted for that category and how the information in those objects get mapped to xacml AttributeId and AttributeValue.

Throws:
java.lang.Exception

testStyleSubjectMapper

public void testStyleSubjectMapper()
                            throws java.lang.Exception
Test #3: JAAS Subject Mapper: JAAS Subject style iii. Adding additional context information from the JAAS Subject

Throws:
java.lang.Exception

testStyleQuery

public void testStyleQuery()
                    throws java.lang.Exception
Test #4: Query Use PolicySet w parallel policy to implement query that returns a filter that can be used to collect lists of allowed resources. Query is implemented by special string "/-" that returns obligation w filter.

Throws:
java.lang.Exception
